params.name: direct_message_deep_link
params.description: Tweets a link directly to a Direct Message conversation with an account.

params.name: for_super_followers_only
params.description: Allows you to Tweet exclusively for Super Followers.

params.name: geo
params.description: A JSON object that contains location information for a Tweet. You can only add a location to Tweets if you have geo enabled in your profile settings. If you don't have geo enabled, you can still add a location parameter in your request body, but it won't get attached to your Tweet

properties.name: geo.place_id
properties.description: Place ID being attached to the Tweet for geo location.

params.name: media
params.description: A JSON object that contains media information being attached to created Tweet. This is mutually exclusive from Quote Tweet ID and Poll.

properties.name: media.media_ids
properties.description: A list of Media IDs being attached to the Tweet. This is only required if the request includes the tagged_user_ids.

properties.name: media.tagged_user_ids
properties.description: A list of User IDs being tagged in the Tweet with Media. If the user you're tagging doesn't have photo-tagging enabled, their names won't show up in the list of tagged users even though the Tweet is successfully created.

params.name: poll
params.description: A JSON object that contains options for a Tweet with a poll. This is mutually exclusive from Media and Quote Tweet ID.

properties.name: poll.duration_minutes
properties.description: Duration of the poll in minutes for a Tweet with a poll. This is only required if the request includes poll.options.

properties.name: poll.options
properties.description: A list of poll options for a Tweet with a poll. For the request to be successful it must also include duration_minutes too.

properties.name: poll.reply_settings
properties.description: Settings to indicate who can reply to the Tweet. Options include "mentionedUsers" and "following". If the field isn’t specified, it will default to everyone.

params.name: quote_tweet_id
params.description: Link to the Tweet being quoted.

params.name: reply
params.description: A JSON object that contains information of the Tweet being replied to.

properties.name: reply.exclude_reply_user_ids
properties.description: A list of User IDs to be excluded from the reply Tweet thus removing a user from a thread.

properties.name: reply.in_reply_to_tweet_id
properties.description: Tweet ID of the Tweet being replied to. Please note that in_reply_to_tweet_id needs to be in the request if exclude_reply_user_ids is present.

params.name: reply_settings
params.description: Settings to indicate who can reply to the Tweet. Options include "mentionedUsers" and "following". If the field isn’t specified, it will default to everyone.

params.name: text
params.description: Text of the Tweet being created. This field is required if media.media_ids is not present.

params.name: query
params.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Refer to https://t.co/rulelength to identify the max query length.

params.name: start_time
params.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).

params.name: end_time
params.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).

params.name: since_id
params.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

params.name: until_id
params.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.

params.name: max_results
params.description: The maximum number of search results to be returned by a request.

params.name: next_token
params.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.

params.name: pagination_token
params.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.

params.name: sort_order
params.description: This order in which to return results.

params.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.

params.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

params.description: A comma separated list of Media fields to display.

params.description: A comma separated list of Poll fields to display.

params.description: A comma separated list of User fields to display.

params.description: A comma separated list of Place fields to display.

params.description: The ID of the Tweet to be deleted.

params.name: max_results
params.description: The maximum number of results.

params.name: pagination_token
params.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results.

params.name: exclude
params.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets').

params.name: start_time
params.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Tweets will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.

params.name: end_time
params.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.

params.name: tweet.fields
params.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.

params.name: expansions
params.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

params.name: media.fields
params.description: A comma separated list of Media fields to display.

params.name: poll.fields
params.description: A comma separated list of Poll fields to display.

params.name: user.fields
params.description: A comma separated list of User fields to display.

params.name: place.fields
params.description: A comma separated list of Place fields to display.

params.name: source_user_id
params.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to unblock the target User.

params.name: target_user_id
params.description: The ID of the User that the source User is requesting to unblock.

params.name: source_user_id
params.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to unfollow the target User.

params.name: target_user_id
params.description: The ID of the User that the source User is requesting to unfollow.

params.name: source_user_id
params.description: The ID of the authenticated source User that is requesting to unmute the target User.

params.name: target_user_id
params.description: The ID of the User that the source User is requesting to unmute.
